wikipedia_page.main: Sir Stephen Finney CIE (8 September 1852 – 1 March 1924) was a rugby union international who represented England from 1872 to 1873.

response: In its day, the college's rugby union team, referred to by its opponents as "Cooper's Hill", was one of the most prominent rugby clubs in England. In the 1870s, it produced a number of famous international players including Stephen Finney, Petley Price, W. C. Hutchinson, N. F. Macleod, and F. D. Fowler.
* Sir Stephen Finney, England rugby internationalEdmund Burke, The Annual register of world events: a review of the year, Volume 166, p119, Longmans, Green, 1925
